page.title: 15Building in Chinley
page.content: Chinley is (or maybe was to you, who are reading this in the far future) a smallish village in the North of England, roughly 15 miles from Manchester. I find it very pleasant to live in Chinley and I will stay here as long as I can find a job in this area. At this time (1985) there is a by-pass being built and it has partly ruined the landscape. Population is approximatley 2500 and growing because of new housing. A majority of houses are made of the local stone (Millstone Grit), which is a yellow-brown colour but after five years turns a dark grey-brown. But now they build in concrete blocks, which are meant to look like stone, but don't. Many of the older houses are protected by law. {by Ben Morris
